00035 template<typename T, bool isNumber> struct getMinMaxImpl {
00036     std::pair<T, T> operator()( const ValuePtr<T> &/*ref*/ ) const {
00037         LOG( Debug, error ) << "min/max comparison of " << util::Value<T>::staticName() << " is not supportet";
00038         return std::pair<T, T>();
00039     }
00040 };
00041 template<typename T> struct getMinMaxImpl<T, true> {
00042     std::pair<T, T> operator()( const ValuePtr<T> &ref ) const {
00043         std::pair<T, T> result;
00044 
00045         for ( size_t i = 0; i < ref.getLength(); i++ ) {
00046             if ( result.second < ref[i] )result.second = ref[i];
00047 
00048             if ( result.first > ref[i] )result.first = ref[i];
00049         }
00050 
00051         return result;
00052     }
00053 };
00054 
00055 }

00065 template<typename TYPE> class ValuePtr: public _internal::ValuePtrBase
00066 {
00067     boost::shared_ptr<TYPE> m_val;
00068     template<typename T> ValuePtr( const util::Value<T>& value ); // Dont do this
00069 protected:
00070     ValuePtrBase *clone() const {
00071         return new ValuePtr( *this );
00072     }
00074     class DelProxy : public boost::shared_ptr<TYPE>
00075     {
00076     public:
00082         DelProxy( const ValuePtr<TYPE> &master ): boost::shared_ptr<TYPE>( master ) {
00083             LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Creating DelProxy for " << this->get();
00084         }
00086         void operator()( TYPE *at ) {
00087             LOG( Debug, verbose_info )
00088                     << "Deletion for " << this->get() << " called from splice at offset "   << at - this->get()
00089                     << ", current use_count: " << this->use_count();
00090             this->reset();//actually not needed, but we keep it here to keep obfuscation low
00091         }
00092     };
00093 public:
00094     static const unsigned short staticID = util::_internal::TypeID<TYPE>::value << 8;
00096     struct NonDeleter {
00097         void operator()( TYPE *p ) {
00098             //we have to cast the pointer to void* here, because in case of u_int8_t it will try to print the "string"
00099             LOG( Debug, info ) << "Not freeing pointer " << ( void * )p << " (" << ValuePtr<TYPE>::staticName() << ") ";
00100         };
00101     };
00103     struct BasicDeleter {
00104         void operator()( TYPE *p ) {
00105             //we have to cast the pointer to void* here, because in case of u_int8_t it will try to print the "string"
00106             LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Freeing pointer " << ( void * )p << " (" << ValuePtr<TYPE>::staticName() << ") ";
00107             free( p );
00108         };
00109     };
00111     struct ObjectArrayDeleter {
00112         void operator()( TYPE *p ) {
00113             //we have to cast the pointer to void* here, because in case of u_int8_t it will try to print the "string"
00114             LOG( Debug, info ) << "Deleting object array at " << ( void * )p << " (" << ValuePtr<TYPE>::staticName() << ") ";
00115             delete[] p;
00116         };
00117     };
00122     ValuePtr() {
00123         LOG( Debug, warning ) << "Creating an empty ValuePtr of type " << util::MSubject( staticName() ) << " you should overwrite it with a usefull pointer before using it";
00124     }
00125 
00135     ValuePtr( TYPE *const ptr, size_t length ):
00136         _internal::ValuePtrBase( length ), m_val( ptr, BasicDeleter() ) {}

00171     void copyFromMem( const TYPE *const src, size_t _length ) {
00172         LOG_IF( _length > getLength(), Runtime, error )
00173                 << "Amount of the elements to copy from memory (" << _length << ") exceeds the length of the array (" << getLength() << ")";
00174         TYPE &dest = this->operator[]( 0 );
00175         LOG( Debug, info ) << "Copying " << _length *sizeof( TYPE ) << " bytes from " << ValuePtr<TYPE>::staticName() << src << " to " << getTypeName() << &dest;
00176         memcpy( &dest, src, _length * sizeof( TYPE ) );
00177     }
00179     void copyToMem( size_t start, size_t end, TYPE *const dst )const {
00180         assert( start <= end );
00181         const size_t _length = end - start + 1;
00182         LOG_IF( end >= getLength(), Runtime, error )
00183                 << "End of the range (" << end << ") is behind the end of this ValuePtr (" << getLength() << ")";
00184         const TYPE &source = this->operator[]( start );
00185         memcpy( dst, &source, _length * sizeof( TYPE ) );
00186     }
00187 
00188     size_t compare( size_t start, size_t end, const _internal::ValuePtrBase &dst, size_t dst_start ) const {
00189         assert( start <= end );
00190         size_t ret = 0;
00191         size_t _length = end - start;
00192 
00193         if ( dst.getTypeID() != getTypeID() ) {
00194             LOG( Debug, error )
00195                     << "Comparing to a ValuePtr of different type(" << dst.getTypeName() << ", not " << getTypeName()
00196                     << "). Assuming all voxels to be different";
00197             return _length;
00198         }
00199 
00200         LOG_IF( end >= getLength(), Runtime, error )
00201                 << "End of the range (" << end << ") is behind the end of this ValuePtr (" << getLength() << ")";
00202         LOG_IF( _length + dst_start >= dst.getLength(), Runtime, error )
00203                 << "End of the range (" << _length + dst_start << ") is behind the end of the destination (" << dst.getLength() << ")";
00204         const ValuePtr<TYPE> &cmp = dst.castToValuePtr<TYPE>();
00205         LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Comparing " << dst.getTypeName() << " at " << &operator[]( 0 ) << " and " << &cmp[0];
00206 
00207         for ( size_t i = start; i < end; i++ ) {
00208             if ( ! ( operator[]( i ) == cmp[i] ) ) {
00209                 ret++;
00210             }
00211         }
00212 
00213         return ret;
00214     }
00215 
00217     virtual std::string toString( bool labeled = false )const {
00218         std::string ret;
00219 
00220         if ( m_len ) {
00221             const TYPE *ptr = m_val.get();
00222 
00223             for ( size_t i = 0; i < m_len - 1; i++ )
00224                 ret += util::Value<TYPE>( ptr[i] ).toString( false ) + "|";
00225 
00226             ret += util::Value<TYPE>( ptr[m_len-1] ).toString( labeled );
00227         }
00228 
00229         return boost::lexical_cast<std::string>( m_len ) + "#" + ret;
00230     }
00232     virtual std::string getTypeName()const {
00233         return staticName();
00234     }

00237         return staticID;

00253         return ( m_val.get() )[idx];

00272     std::pair<util::ValueReference, util::ValueReference> getMinMax()const {
00273         if ( getLength() == 0 ) {
00274             LOG( Runtime, warning ) << "Skipping computation of min/max on an empty ValuePtr";
00275             std::pair<util::ValueReference, util::ValueReference>();
00276         }
00277 
00278         const std::pair<util::Value<TYPE>, util::Value<TYPE> > result = _internal::getMinMaxImpl<TYPE, boost::is_arithmetic<TYPE>::value>()( *this );
00279 
00280         return std::make_pair( util::ValueReference( result.first ), util::ValueReference( result.second ) );
00281     }
00282 
00283     std::vector<Reference> splice( size_t size )const {
00284         if ( size >= getLength() ) {
00285             LOG( Debug, warning )
00286                     << "splicing data of the size " << getLength() << " up into blocks of the size " << size << " is kind of useless ...";
00287         }
00288 
00289         const size_t fullSplices = getLength() / size;
00290 
00291         const size_t lastSize = getLength() % size;//rest of the division - size of the last splice
00292 
00293         const size_t splices = fullSplices + ( lastSize ? 1 : 0 );
00294 
00295         std::vector<Reference> ret( splices );
00296 
00297         DelProxy proxy( *this );
00298 
00299         for ( size_t i = 0; i < fullSplices; i++ )
00300             ret[i].reset( new ValuePtr( m_val.get() + i * size, size, proxy ) );
00301 
00302         if ( lastSize )
00303             ret.back().reset( new ValuePtr( m_val.get() + fullSplices * size, lastSize, proxy ) );
00304 
00305         return ret;
00306     }
00307     //
00308 
00309 };

00311 template<typename T> bool _internal::ValuePtrBase::is()const
00312 {
00313     util::checkType<T>();
00314     return getTypeID() == ValuePtr<T>::staticID;
00315 }
